title: Area in first quadrant b/w linear and rational

content.description: Let R be the region bounded by the y-axis and the graphs of y = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C14@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and y = 4 - 2x, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: Find the area of R.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using Æ’'(x), y', and dy/dx).
